text: The 2018–19 Liiga season was the 44th season of the Liiga (formerly SM-liiga), the top level of ice hockey in Finland, since the league's formation in 1975. ==Teams== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Team !! City !! Head coach !! Arena !! Capacity !! Captain |- | HIFK || Helsinki || ~~Ari-Pekka Selin~~ 25 Jan 2019 Jarno Pikkarainen || Helsingin jäähalli || || Lennart Petrell |- | HPK || Hämeenlinna || Antti Pennanen || Patria-areena || || Otto Paajanen |- | Ilves || Tampere || Karri Kivi || Tampereen jäähalli || || Eemeli Suomi |- | Jukurit || Mikkeli || Pekka Kangasalusta || Kalevankankaan jäähalli || || Miika Roine |- | JYP || || ~~Lauri Merikivi~~ 14 Jan 2019 Risto Dufva || Synergia-areena || || Juha-Pekka Hytönen |- | KalPa || Kuopio || Sami Kapanen || Niiralan monttu || || Tommi Jokinen |- | KooKoo || Kouvola || ~~Tuomas Tuokkola~~ 8 Jan 2019 Mikko Heiskanen || Lumon arena || || Toni Kähkönen |- | Kärpät || Oulu || Mikko Manner || Oulun Energia Areena || || Atte Ohtamaa |- | Lukko || Rauma || Pekka Virta || Äijänsuo Arena || || Janne Niskala |- | Pelicans || Lahti || Ville Nieminen || Isku Areena || || Hannes Björninen |- | SaiPa || Lappeenranta || Tero Lehterä || Kisapuisto || || Ville Koho |- | Sport || Vaasa || Ari-Pekka Pajuluoma || Vaasa Arena || || Erik Riska |- | Tappara || Tampere || Jukka Rautakorpi || Tampereen jäähalli || || Kristian Kuusela |- | TPS || Turku || Kalle Kaskinen || HK Arena || || Lauri Korpikoski |- | || Pori || ~~Mikael Kotkaniemi~~ 9 Nov 2018 Pasi Kaukoranta || Porin jäähalli || || Tommi Taimi |} ==Regular season== Top six advanced straight to the quarter-finals, while teams between 7th and 10th positions played a wild card round for the final two spots. The Liiga is a closed series and thus there is no relegation. Rules for classification: 1) Points; 2) 3-point wins 3) Goal difference; 4) Goals scored; 4) Head-to-head points. == Playoffs == === Bracket === ===Wild card round=== ===Quarterfinals=== ===Semifinals=== ===Bronze medal game=== === Finals === HPK wins the finals 4-3. ==Final rankings== {| class="wikitable" style="width:200px;" |- style="background:#F7F6A8;" |align=center|Image:gold medal icon.svg|| HPK |- style="background:#DCE5E5;" |align=center|Image:silver medal icon.svg|| Kärpät |- style="background:#FFDAB9;" |align=center|Image:bronze medal icon.svg|| Tappara |- |align=center|4|| HIFK |- |align=center|5|| Pelicans |- |align=center|6|| TPS |- |align=center|7|| Lukko |- |align=center|8|| Ilves |- |align=center|9|| SaiPa |- |align=center|10|| JYP |- |align=center|11|| Sport |- |align=center|12|| KalPa |- |align=center|13|| KooKoo |- |align=center|14|| Jukurit |- |align=center|15|| Ässät |} ==See also== * 2018–19 Mestis season ==References== Category:Liiga seasons Liiga Liiga
title: 2018–19 Liiga season
